DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/access/ide.description: Deletes an identity provider from Access.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

202.description: Delete an Access identity provider response

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

4XX.description: Delete an Access identity provider response failure

x-api-token-group: Access: Organizations, Identity Providers, and Groups Write

schema.description: Indicates to Access to only retrieve identity providers that have the System for Cross-Domain Identity Management (SCIM) enabled.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

count.description: Total number of results for the requested service

page.description: Current page within paginated list of results

per_page.description: Number of results per page of results

total_count.description: Total results available without any search parameters

config.description: The configuration parameters for the identity provider. To view the required parameters for a specific provider, refer to our [developer documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/identity/idp-integration/).

name.description: The name of the identity provider, shown to users on the login page.

scim_config.description: The configuration settings for enabling a System for Cross-Domain Identity Management (SCIM) with the identity provider.

enabled.description: A flag to enable or disable SCIM for the identity provider.

identity_update_behavior.description: Indicates how a SCIM event updates a user identity used for policy evaluation. Use "automatic" to automatically update a user's identity and augment it with fields from the SCIM user resource. Use "reauth" to force re-authentication on group membership updates, user identity update will only occur after successful re-authentication. With "reauth" identities will not contain fields from the SCIM user resource. With "no_action" identities will not be changed by SCIM updates in any way and users will not be prompted to reauthenticate.

scim_base_url.description: The base URL of Cloudflare's SCIM V2.0 API endpoint.

seat_deprovision.description: A flag to remove a user's seat in Zero Trust when they have been deprovisioned in the Identity Provider.  This cannot be enabled unless user_deprovision is also enabled.

secret.description: A read-only token generated when the SCIM integration is enabled for the first time.  It is redacted on subsequent requests.  If you lose this you will need to refresh it at /access/identity_providers/:idpID/refresh_scim_secret.

user_deprovision.description: A flag to enable revoking a user's session in Access and Gateway when they have been deprovisioned in the Identity Provider.

type.description: The type of identity provider. To determine the value for a specific provider, refer to our [developer documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/identity/idp-integration/).

email_claim_name.description: The claim name for email in the id_token response.

conditional_access_enabled.description: Should Cloudflare try to load authentication contexts from your account

prompt.description: Indicates the type of user interaction that is required. prompt=login forces the user to enter their credentials on that request, negating single-sign on. prompt=none is the opposite. It ensures that the user isn't presented with any interactive prompt. If the request can't be completed silently by using single-sign on, the Microsoft identity platform returns an interaction_required error. prompt=select_account interrupts single sign-on providing account selection experience listing all the accounts either in session or any remembered account or an option to choose to use a different account altogether.

support_groups.description: Should Cloudflare try to load groups from your account

prompt.description: Indicates the type of user interaction that is required. prompt=login forces the user to enter their credentials on that request, negating single-sign on. prompt=none is the opposite. It ensures that the user isn't presented with any interactive prompt. If the request can't be completed silently by using single-sign on, the Microsoft identity platform returns an interaction_required error. prompt=select_account interrupts single sign-on providing account selection experience listing all the accounts either in session or any remembered account or an option to choose to use a different account altogether.

support_groups.description: Should Cloudflare try to load groups from your account

config.description: The configuration parameters for the identity provider. To view the required parameters for a specific provider, refer to our [developer documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/identity/idp-integration/).

name.description: The name of the identity provider, shown to users on the login page.

scim_config.description: The configuration settings for enabling a System for Cross-Domain Identity Management (SCIM) with the identity provider.

enabled.description: A flag to enable or disable SCIM for the identity provider.

identity_update_behavior.description: Indicates how a SCIM event updates a user identity used for policy evaluation. Use "automatic" to automatically update a user's identity and augment it with fields from the SCIM user resource. Use "reauth" to force re-authentication on group membership updates, user identity update will only occur after successful re-authentication. With "reauth" identities will not contain fields from the SCIM user resource. With "no_action" identities will not be changed by SCIM updates in any way and users will not be prompted to reauthenticate.

scim_base_url.description: The base URL of Cloudflare's SCIM V2.0 API endpoint.

seat_deprovision.description: A flag to remove a user's seat in Zero Trust when they have been deprovisioned in the Identity Provider.  This cannot be enabled unless user_deprovision is also enabled.

secret.description: A read-only token generated when the SCIM integration is enabled for the first time.  It is redacted on subsequent requests.  If you lose this you will need to refresh it at /access/identity_providers/:idpID/refresh_scim_secret.

user_deprovision.description: A flag to enable revoking a user's session in Access and Gateway when they have been deprovisioned in the Identity Provider.

type.description: The type of identity provider. To determine the value for a specific provider, refer to our [developer documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/identity/idp-integration/).

email_claim_name.description: The claim name for email in the id_token response.

conditional_access_enabled.description: Should Cloudflare try to load authentication contexts from your account

prompt.description: Indicates the type of user interaction that is required. prompt=login forces the user to enter their credentials on that request, negating single-sign on. prompt=none is the opposite. It ensures that the user isn't presented with any interactive prompt. If the request can't be completed silently by using single-sign on, the Microsoft identity platform returns an interaction_required error. prompt=select_account interrupts single sign-on providing account selection experience listing all the accounts either in session or any remembered account or an option to choose to use a different account altogether.

support_groups.description: Should Cloudflare try to load groups from your account

prompt.description: Indicates the type of user interaction that is required. prompt=login forces the user to enter their credentials on that request, negating single-sign on. prompt=none is the opposite. It ensures that the user isn't presented with any interactive prompt. If the request can't be completed silently by using single-sign on, the Microsoft identity platform returns an interaction_required error. prompt=select_account interrupts single sign-on providing account selection experience listing all the accounts either in session or any remembered account or an option to choose to use a different account altogether.

secret.description: A read-only token generated when the SCIM integration is enabled for the first time.  It is redacted on subsequent requests.  If you lose this you will need to refresh it at /access/identity_providers/:idpID/refresh_scim_secret.

user_deprovision.description: A flag to enable revoking a user's session in Access and Gateway when they have been deprovisioned in the Identity Provider.

type.description: The type of identity provider. To determine the value for a specific provider, refer to our [developer documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/identity/idp-integration/).

config.description: The configuration parameters for the identity provider. To view the required parameters for a specific provider, refer to our [developer documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/identity/idp-integration/).

name.description: The name of the identity provider, shown to users on the login page.

scim_config.description: The configuration settings for enabling a System for Cross-Domain Identity Management (SCIM) with the identity provider.

enabled.description: A flag to enable or disable SCIM for the identity provider.

identity_update_behavior.description: Indicates how a SCIM event updates a user identity used for policy evaluation. Use "automatic" to automatically update a user's identity and augment it with fields from the SCIM user resource. Use "reauth" to force re-authentication on group membership updates, user identity update will only occur after successful re-authentication. With "reauth" identities will not contain fields from the SCIM user resource. With "no_action" identities will not be changed by SCIM updates in any way and users will not be prompted to reauthenticate.

conditional_access_enabled.description: Should Cloudflare try to load authentication contexts from your account

prompt.description: Indicates the type of user interaction that is required. prompt=login forces the user to enter their credentials on that request, negating single-sign on. prompt=none is the opposite. It ensures that the user isn't presented with any interactive prompt. If the request can't be completed silently by using single-sign on, the Microsoft identity platform returns an interaction_required error. prompt=select_account interrupts single sign-on providing account selection experience listing all the accounts either in session or any remembered account or an option to choose to use a different account altogether.

support_groups.description: Should Cloudflare try to load groups from your account

config.description: The configuration parameters for the identity provider. To view the required parameters for a specific provider, refer to our [developer documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/identity/idp-integration/).

name.description: The name of the identity provider, shown to users on the login page.

scim_config.description: The configuration settings for enabling a System for Cross-Domain Identity Management (SCIM) with the identity provider.

enabled.description: A flag to enable or disable SCIM for the identity provider.

identity_update_behavior.description: Indicates how a SCIM event updates a user identity used for policy evaluation. Use "automatic" to automatically update a user's identity and augment it with fields from the SCIM user resource. Use "reauth" to force re-authentication on group membership updates, user identity update will only occur after successful re-authentication. With "reauth" identities will not contain fields from the SCIM user resource. With "no_action" identities will not be changed by SCIM updates in any way and users will not be prompted to reauthenticate.

scim_base_url.description: The base URL of Cloudflare's SCIM V2.0 API endpoint.

seat_deprovision.description: A flag to remove a user's seat in Zero Trust when they have been deprovisioned in the Identity Provider.  This cannot be enabled unless user_deprovision is also enabled.

secret.description: A read-only token generated when the SCIM integration is enabled for the first time.  It is redacted on subsequent requests.  If you lose this you will need to refresh it at /access/identity_providers/:idpID/refresh_scim_secret.

user_deprovision.description: A flag to enable revoking a user's session in Access and Gateway when they have been deprovisioned in the Identity Provider.
